title: Union Standard restaurant opens tomorrow in Downtown
text:
Union Standard restaurant opens tomorrow in Downtown February 16, 2017 4:54 PM Nate Guidry/Post-Gazette Chef Derek Stevens stands in the kitchen at the Union Standard, a major new restaurant opening in the refurbished Union Trust Building. Nate Guidry/Post-Gazette A aerial view of the bar area at the Union Standard, a major new restaurant opening in the refurbished Union Trust Building. Nate Guidry/Post-Gazette A view of the entrance at the Union Standard. Nate Guidry/Post-Gazette A view of the bar area in the Union Standard. Nate Guidry/Post-Gazette A view of the dining area at the Union Standard. By Dan Gigler / Pittsburgh Post-Gazette 
More than a year in the making, Union Standard by chef Derek Stevens will open to the public tomorrow. 
It is the first major new restaurant to open in Downtown Pittsburgh in 2017 and is a centerpiece attraction to the $100 million refurbishment and modernization of the opulent Union Trust Building by the Boston-based The Davis Companies., which owns the building. 
Mr. Stevens helped open Strip District restaurant Eleven and rose to be executive chef there before leaving to develop Union Standard. The menu at Union Standard focuses on whole roasted meats and vegetables, local heirloom crops and foraged native foods, with a wood-fired grill and rotisserie key components of the kitchen. There also will be a raw bar featuring oysters and chilled shellfish.
